subject: p16360107
History: Chest pain evaluate for cardiomegaly, edema or effusion.
Findings: Frontal and lateral radiographs of the chest demonstrate stable mild enlargement of the cardiac silhouette. There is stable appearance of fragmentation and misalignment of the sternal wires. The chronic loculated pleural effusions are unchanged with persistent bibasilar opacification. There is slight increase in pulmonary vascular congestion compared to the prior study. No pneumothorax is detected.
